revised_title: Diffuse Reflexions of X-rays by Crystals: A Study of Thermal Factors
tldr: The author investigates the diffuse reflexions of X-rays by crystals and their relationship to thermal factors. They find that the lack of phase relationship in the diffuse-area pattern is due to thermal agitation, which causes individual molecules to be displaced randomly. The author also compares the patterns found by X-rays and electron diffraction, noting differences in their associations with molecular orientation and intermolecular forces.
